basics.name: Ben-orli
basics.label: Data Science | Neuroscience
basics.summary: Here are projects I've been working on. I hope you can find something interesting!

work.name: EdPlace
work.summary: Developed the recommendation system used by EdPlace (www.edplace.com, over 100,000 users), using collaborative filtering to match users with worksheets. Improved performance was unanimously agreed on by stakeholders used on the site.
highlights: EdPlace needed a worksheet recommender to engage users with more appropriate content, improving user experience, learning, and retention. Our team was able to provide this.
Wrote Python functions to recommend easier worksheets when children were struggling.
Used set theory to find a worksheet similarity measure based on student completion. This gave rich, user defined connections between worksheets, going deeper than subject and year.
Optimised worksheet overlap calculation by finding pre-computable components, Python sets, and NumPy vectorization, resulting in a 120x time reduction, making the method usable.
Accessed and cleaned large volumes of server data, working on AWS and using awswrangler.
Fixed security and versioning issues for a team of 6, on our shared GitHub repository.

work.name: Medical University of Vienna
work.summary: Dimension reduced data and built supervised ML models in Python, which can predict the behaviour of rats from single neuron activity. This will enable an article to be submitted for peer review (first author - finalising). Received a €600 grant from ANA to present this work at the largest neuroscience conference in Europe (FENS).
highlights: Decision confidence is in all decision-making. High confidence errors are linked to hallucination. I helped to uncover how neurons in the prefrontal cortex carry confidence information.
Ran PCA, and K-nearest neighbour models in scikit-learn (Python) on raw spikes for data driven prediction of waiting behaviour, achieving state-of-the-art accuracy (0.2 s RMSE).
Developed a method including optimal width Gaussian kernel convolution and change/slope detection used by the lab to find key events in time series, which will go into publication.
Improved the trial data structure for the entire project. Loops became indexing, group-by statements, and matrix operations. Some processes previously taking hours took seconds.
Co-led a project with a budget of approx €1,000,000 involving several lab members, and a collaboration with a US lab, including a 6-month visitation, also hosting their visit.
Contributed RNA sequencing data, discovering novel markers for brain pathways at CSHL, Long Island, US. Analysing differential expression in R to choose targets (> €1000 per target).
Mentored a masters' student and trained new staff members, including several postdocs.

work.name: Neuromatch Academy
work.summary: Teaching Computational Neuroscience in Python to graduates
highlights: Taught a computational neuroscience course to graduate students from STEM fields, receiving exceptional feedback from students for my teaching and Python code review.
Through years of experience, I rapidly understand material produced by leaders in the field

courses: Project 1: Hyperparameter optimization for a regularized GLM to predict whisker curvature from neuron firing rates.
Project 2: Modelled a substantia nigra microcircuit of 1000 dynamical systems neurons and inhibitory synapses to determine the gain control afforded by inhibitory collateral connections.

volunteer.summary: Qualified to coordinate 2-3 hour educational workshops explaining the IPCC reports.
I helped refugees aged 16-18 adapt to Austrian education, qualifying for work and apprenticeships.
